lines: You and ${spouseName} have had a good marriage up until this point. The local paper singles you out as "Couple Of The Year" and sends you on a vacation cruise around the world! Bon Voyage!

You and ${spouseName} have had what many would consider a "stormy marriage." Lately, ${spouseName} has been thinking about this and has decided that things must change, or he wants out. He has given you the ultimatum that he will not continue the
marriage without some kind of marriage counseling.
If you really feel this strong about not wanting to change anything, I guess a divorce is the best way out.

After speaking with both of you, the counselor has found that there seems to be a lack of communication between you. As far as ${spouseName} is concerned, he tends to get resentful rather than express his true feelings. You also have trouble
Over the course of the marriage counseling, the following things are revealed:
You have not been the most trustworthy wife that you can be.
Your self-destructiveness and impulsive behavior have a tendency to get you into trouble, which in turn upsets your husband.
You are hostile at times, which makes ${spouseName} angry and resentful.
You have a tendency to take control of things without considering the feelings of your husband.
Now that everything is out in the open, you can:
#CALL THE WHOLE THING A BUNCH OF NONSENSE

This stranger has no right to claim that you have these characteristics, even if what the counselor says were true. You feel the counselor sided with your husband. The incident is a disaster. You should seek a divorce in the MARRIAGE ICON.
Your flexibility breathes new life into your marriage. Your problems, at least for the moment, seem to disappear.
